text: Leptosiaphos koutoui is a species of skink, a lizard in the family Scincidae. The species is endemic to Cameroon and is only known from the Adamaoua Massif near Meiganga. ==Etymology== The specific name, koutoui, is in honor of Denis Koulagna Koutou, former Director of Wildlife and Protected Areas in Cameroon.Beolens, Bo; Watkins, Michael; Grayson, Michael (2011). The Eponym Dictionary of Reptiles. Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press. xiii + 296 pp. . (Leptosiaphos koutoui, p. 146). ==Reproduction== L. koutoui is oviparous. ==References== Category:Leptosiaphos Category:Reptiles of Cameroon Category:Endemic fauna of Cameroon Category:Reptiles described in 2004 Category:Taxa named by Ivan Ineich Category:Taxa named by Andreas Schmitz Category:Taxa named by Laurent Chirio Category:Taxa named by Matthew Lebreton
title: Leptosiaphos koutoui
